docs.lead_paragraph: So-called specialty drugs for diseases like rheumatoid arthritis have a narrow use and high costs, leaving the most vulnerable patients with huge bills.

headline.seo: States Seek to Curb Exorbitant Drug Costs Incurred by Patients
headline.main: States Seek Curb on Patient Bills for Costly Drugs
headline.print_headline: States Seek Curb On Patient Bills For Costly Drugs

docs.abstract: Lawmakers in at least 20 states have introduced bills that would limit out-of-pocket payments by consumers for expensive drugs used to treat chronic diseases; bills aim to counter efforts by health plans to reduce the amount they pay for expensive medicines by making patients pay a percentage of the cost.
docs.snippet: So-called specialty drugs for diseases like rheumatoid arthritis have a narrow use and high costs, leaving the most vulnerable patients with huge bills.

docs.lead_paragraph: MARCUS--Philip, MD. It is with great sadness that the doctors, nurses, and employees of Nassau Chest Physicians, P.C. announce the death of our Founder, Philip Marcus, MD, MPH. He was born in extremely humble conditions in New York City in 1946, Dr. Marcus rose to the pinnacle of leadership positions in multiple organizations. He graduated cum laude from Columbia University College of Pharmaceutical Sciences. He received his medical degree from the State University of New York Downstate summa cum laude in 1973. In 2002 he graduated from the Bloomberg School of Public Health, Johns Hopkins University with an MPH. Clinical training included Residency and Chief Residency at Long Island Jewish Medical Center. He was a Resident in Pulmonary Medicine at Long Island Jewish Medical Center and he was the Parker B. Francis Fellow in Pulmonary Research at Northport Veterans Hospital in Northport, NY. Dr. Marcus received certification in Internal Medicine, Pulmonary Diseases, and Critical Care Medicine. Dr. Marcus was the Director of the Division of Pulmonary Medicine at St. Francis Hospital in Roslyn, NY. He was the Associate Dean of Curriculum Development at New York College of Osteopathic Medicine. He also had been Chairman of the Department of Medicine at the same college. He was Adjunct Associate Professor in the Department of Pharmaceutical Sciences School of Medicine at the State University of New York at Stony Brook. His professional activities included multiple leadership positions in the American College of Chest Physicians. He rose to the Board of Regents and was chairman of multiple committees. He was on the Editorial Advisory Board of the journal, CHEST. He was on the Editorial Board of the Annals of Respiratory Medicine and a reviewer for Allergy, and Annals of Internal Medicine. He has been a panel member for over fifteen years for US Pharmacopeia and has been on Advisory Committees for the FDA. He was president of the American Lung Association of Nassau/Suffolk from 1991 to 1995. He continued to serve as a Member of the Board of Directors of the American Lung Association. He was also a major fundraiser for Jewish causes including UJA and Shaare Zedek Hospital in Jerusalem. Dr. Marcus has practiced Pulmonary Medicine on Long Island since 1978. He is the Founding Physician of Nassau Chest Physicians, P.C which has grown to eleven physicians and three nurse practitioners. Starting as one of the few Board Certified Pulmonary Physicians on Long Island, he was personally responsible for making NCP one of the premier Pulmonary Medicine groups in the area. He was a great teacher, mentor, and friend to everyone associated with him. The employees at Nassau Chest Physicians will miss him forever. Sympathies to his wife Rovena, his children, and his grandchildren. The Members of Nassau Chest Physicians, P.C.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Romney campaign removed ads critical of Rick Santorum after Mr. Santorum’s disabled daughter, Bella, was hospitalized.

headline.main: A Shift in Strategy in Pennsylvania for Romney
headline.print_headline: A Shift in Strategy in Pennsylvania for Romney

docs.abstract: Romney campaign pulls ads critical of Republican presidential rival Rick Santorum in Pennsylvania after Santorum’s three-year-old disabled daughter, Bella, is hospitalized; her medical struggles--and the public outpouring of sympathy for her--have the potential to complicate Romney's efforts to quickly end the Republican nominating fight.
docs.snippet: The Romney campaign removed ads critical of Rick Santorum after Mr. Santorum’s disabled daughter, Bella, was hospitalized.

byline.contributor: Trip Gabriel reported from New York, and Katharine Q. Seelye from Bedford, Pa.
byline.original: By TRIP GABRIEL and KATHARINE Q. SEELYE

docs.lead_paragraph: There is evidence that more lives are being lost to heart and respiratory ills, as well as infectious diseases spread by carriers whose habitats are expanding.

headline.seo: Is Climate Change Resulting in Higher Rates of Illness?

docs.abstract: Science Q&A on whether climate change will affect the incidence of diseases and medical conditions.
docs.snippet: There is evidence that more lives are being lost to heart and respiratory ills, as well as infectious diseases spread by carriers whose habitats are expanding.
